meanings.definition: A person who climbs with difficulty or in an awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: The young clamberer struggled to reach the top of the playground structure.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber was skilled, unlike the clamberer who struggled on the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The clamberer tried to ascend the tree but ended up tangled in branches.
meanings.sent4: The determined clamberer made it to the summit despite the challenging terrain.
meanings.sent5: The little clamberer's efforts to scale the fence were both amusing and endearing.

meanings.definition: To climb with difficulty or in an awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: She had to clamber over the fallen tree trunk to continue along the path.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to clamber onto the high shelf but kept slipping off.
meanings.sent3: He had to clamber up the steep hill, feeling like a clumsy bear.
meanings.sent4: The vines allowed the explorer to clamber up the ancient ruins like a spider.
meanings.sent5: The children had to clamber up the muddy slope to reach the hidden cave entrance.
